abstract: Returns the height in points of the row containing `item`.

declaration.code: @MainActor optional func outlineView(_ outlineView: NSOutlineView, heightOfRowByItem item: Any) -> CGFloat

overview:
## Return Value

The height of the row.

## Discussion

Values returned by this method should not include intercell spacing and must be greater than `0`.

Implement this method to support an outline view with varying row heights.

For large tables in particular, you should make sure that this method is efficient. `NSOutlineView` may cache the values this method returns, so if you would like to change a row’s height make sure to invalidate the row height by calling [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/noteHeightOfRows(withIndexesChanged:)]. `NSOutlineView` automatically invalidates its entire row height cache in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/reloadData()] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/noteNumberOfRowsChanged()].

If you call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/view(atColumn:row:makeIfNecessary:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/rowView(atRow:makeIfNecessary:)] within your implementation of this method, an exception is thrown.

# outlineView(_:heightOfRowByItem:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the height in points of the row containing `item`.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func outlineView(_ outlineView: NSOutlineView, heightOfRowByItem item: Any) -> CGFloat
```

## Parameters

- **outlineView**: The outline view that sent the message.
- **item**: The row item.

## Return Value

The height of the row.

## Discussion

Values returned by this method should not include intercell spacing and must be greater than `0`.

Implement this method to support an outline view with varying row heights.

For large tables in particular, you should make sure that this method is efficient. `NSOutlineView` may cache the values this method returns, so if you would like to change a row’s height make sure to invalidate the row height by calling [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/noteHeightOfRows(withIndexesChanged:)]. `NSOutlineView` automatically invalidates its entire row height cache in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/reloadData()] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/noteNumberOfRowsChanged()].

If you call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/view(atColumn:row:makeIfNecessary:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/rowView(atRow:makeIfNecessary:)] within your implementation of this method, an exception is thrown.



## Customizing Column and Row Sizes

- **outlineView(_:sizeToFitWidthOfColumn:)**: Invoked to allow the delegate to provide custom sizing behavior when a column’s resize divider is double clicked.
